intro: Neobartlettia maxonii, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers open at dusk and close by morning, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Neobartlettia maxonii is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
